H0.text: Atoms are a type of matter that can be separated by physical means.

H1.text: An element is the type of matter that can be separated by physical means.

H2.text: Compound is the type of matter that can be separated by physical means.

H3.text: Mixture is the type of matter that can be separated by physical means.

A4.text: Separations exploit differences in chemical properties or physical properties (such as size, shape, charge, mass, density, or chemical affinity) between the constituents of a mixture.
